Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
A simple implementation of the Board interface

The SimpleBoard class manages the game state, including:

  • The current game matrix (board)
  • The active brick and its position
  • Brick generation and rotation
  • Row clearing and score updates
  • Preview of upcoming bricks

It coordinates with BrickGenerator, BrickRotator, and MatrixOperations to handle gameplay mechanics

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current brick to its next orientation

      Uses BrickRotator.getNextShape() to preview the rotation and checks for collisions before applying it

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current brick into the background board matrix

      This is typically called when the brick can no longer move down

      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears any completed rows from the board

      Uses MatrixOperations.checkRemoving(int[][]) to detect and remove full rows, shifting remaining rows downward

      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      a ClearRow object containing the number of rows cleared, the updated matrix, and the score bonus
